plugin.name: ðŸ•“ Event Helpers
plugin.description: Commands to extend NotePlan's events handling, including calendar lists, time blocks, and date offset templating. See link for more details, and configuration.
plugin.author: jgclark
plugin.lastUpdateInfo:
0.21.0: improvements to '/shift dates' and '/process date offsets'.
0.20.3: new 'STOPMATCHING' placeholder for '/insert matching events'.
0.20.2: upper-case letters allowed in offsets.
0.20.1: adds support for time blocks in Checklists (available from NP 3.8). 0.20.0: can now insert a 'MEETINGNOTE' link next to each item. Please read important note in the README file on how to enable it.
0.19.4: can now include 'calendarSet' and 'calendarNameMappings' parameters when using event lists from Templates.
0.19.3: de-dupes lists of attendees in event lists.

plugin.commands.name: time blocks to calendar
plugin.commands.description: promote time blocks to be full calendar events

plugin.commands.name: insert day's events as list
plugin.commands.description: insert list of this day's calendar events at cursor

plugin.commands.name: insert matching events
plugin.commands.description: inserts this day's calendar events matching certain patterns at cursor

plugin.commands.name: process date offsets
plugin.commands.description: finds date offset patterns and turns them into due dates, based on date at start of section

plugin.commands.name: shift dates
plugin.commands.description: takes dates in the selection and shifts them forwards or backwards by a given date interval

plugin.commands.name: listDaysEvents
plugin.commands.description: function to list events for the current open Calendar note (for use in Templating)

plugin.commands.name: listMatchingDaysEvents
plugin.commands.description: function to list events for the current open Calendar note that match string defined in the settings (for use in Templating)

plugin.settings.title: Settings for insert day's events as list
Events heading
plugin.settings.description: Optional heading to put before list of the day's events (include any '#' heading markers)

plugin.settings.title: Events List display format
plugin.settings.description:
The format string to use to customise how events are displayed (when run as a /command, not through a Template). The available placeholders are 'CAL', 'TITLE', 'EVENTLINK', 'DATE', 'START', 'END', 'NOTES', 'ATTENDEES', 'NOTES', 'URL', 'MEETINGNOTE'. Each placeholder needs to be wrapped by '*|...|*'.
(Default is '- (*|CAL, |**|START|*) *|TITLE|**|
EVENTLINK|**|
with ATTENDEES|**|
NOTES|*'.)

plugin.settings.title: Events List display format for all-day events
plugin.settings.description:
The format string to use to customise how all-day events are displayed (when run as a /command, not through a Template). The available placeholders are 'CAL', 'TITLE', 'EVENTLINK', 'DATE', 'NOTES', 'ATTENDEES', 'NOTES', 'URL', 'MEETINGNOTE'. Each placeholder needs to be wrapped by '*|...|*'.
(Default is '- (*|CAL, |**|START|*) *|TITLE|**|
EVENTLINK|**|
with ATTENDEES|**|
NOTES|*'.)

plugin.settings.title: Sort order of events list
plugin.settings.description: By 'time' or by 'calendar'

plugin.settings.title: Calendars to include
plugin.settings.description: Comma-separated list of calendar names to filter by when showing list of events. If empty, no filtering will be done, and so all calendars will be included.

plugin.settings.title: Calendar name mappings
plugin.settings.description: Map a calendar name to a new string - e.g. 'Jonathan' -> 'J' with 'Jonathan;J'. Separating the two parts of a mapping with semicolons, and use commas between maps.

plugin.settings.title: Meeting Note Template title
plugin.settings.description: If set, this will be the title of the template used to create meeting notes. If not set, you'll be asked which Template (of type 'meeting-note') you'd like to use when run.

plugin.settings.title: Matching Events heading
plugin.settings.description: Optional heading to put before list of matched events (include any '#' heading markers)

plugin.settings.title: Events match list
plugin.settings.description:
Match events with string on left, and then the string on the right is the template for how to insert this event.  The available placeholders are 'STOPMATCHING', 'CAL', 'TITLE', 'EVENTLINK', 'DATE', 'START', 'END', 'NOTES', 'ATTENDEES', 'NOTES', 'URL', 'MEETINGNOTE'. Each placeholder needs to be wrapped by '*|...|*'.
(See README for details)

plugin.settings.title: Stop after first match in the list above?
plugin.settings.description: Note: this doesn't stop matching the rest of the events in the Calendars, but it will mean only the first match above is used for a given event.

plugin.settings.title: Include time blocks from completed tasks?
plugin.settings.description: Include time blocks from completed task and checklist lines?

plugin.settings.title: Name of Calendar to write to
plugin.settings.description: The calendar name to write events to. Must be a writable calendar. If empty, then the default system calendar will be used.

plugin.settings.title: Default event duration
plugin.settings.description: Event duration (in minutes) to use when making an event from a time block, if an end time is not given.

plugin.settings.title: Confirm Event Creation?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to ask user to confirm each event to be created

plugin.settings.title: Remove time blocks when processed?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to remove time block in a line after making an event from it

plugin.settings.title: Add event link?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to add an event link in place of the time block, when creating an event from it

plugin.settings.title: Processed tag name
plugin.settings.description: (Optional) Tag to add on a line after making its time block an event

plugin.settings.title: Remove @done dates?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to remove @done(...) dates, if present, when shifting dates.

plugin.settings.title: Set any closed tasks or checklists to open?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to change any completed or cancelled tasks or checklists back to open.

plugin.settings.title: Remove any 'processed tag name' on tasks or checklists?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to remove any 'processed tag name' (as set above) from tasks or checklists

plugin.settings.title: Locale
plugin.settings.description: Locale to use for the date and times in events. If not given, will default to what the OS reports, or failing that, 'en-US'.

plugin.settings.title: Time options
plugin.settings.description:
Optional Time format settings (from Javascript's Intl definition).
Default: {"hour": "2-digit", "minute": "2-digit", "hour12": false }

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description: Set how much output will be displayed for this plugin the NotePlan > Help > Plugin Console. DEBUG is the most verbose; NONE is the least (silent)
